org.elasticsearch.cloud.aws

Interface AwsEc2Service.DISCOVERY_EC2

  • Enclosing interface:
    AwsEc2Service

    public static interface AwsEc2Service.DISCOVERY_EC2
    Defines discovery settings for ec2. Starting with discovery.ec2.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AwsEc2Service.DISCOVERY_EC2.HostType 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.lang.Boolean> ANY_GROUP_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.any_group: If set to false, will require all security groups to be present for the instance to be used for the discovery.
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> AVAILABILITY_ZONES_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.availability_zones: Either a comma separated list or array based list of availability zones.
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> GROUPS_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.groups: Either a comma separated list or array based list of (security) groups.
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<AwsEc2Service.DISCOVERY_EC2.HostType> HOST_TYPE_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.host_type: The type of host type to use to communicate with other instances.
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<org.elasticsearch.common.unit.TimeValue> NODE_CACHE_TIME_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.node_cache_time: How long the list of hosts is cached to prevent further requests to the AWS API.
      static org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Settings> TAG_SETTING
      discovery.ec2.tag.*: The ec2 discovery can filter machines to include in the cluster based on tags (and not just groups).

    • Field Detail

      • HOST_TYPE_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<AwsEc2Service.DISCOVERY_EC2.HostType> HOST_TYPE_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.host_type: The type of host type to use to communicate with other instances. Can be one of private_ip, public_ip, private_dns, public_dns. Defaults to private_ip.

      • ANY_GROUP_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.lang.Boolean> ANY_GROUP_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.any_group: If set to false, will require all security groups to be present for the instance to be used for the discovery. Defaults to true.

      • GROUPS_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> GROUPS_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.groups: Either a comma separated list or array based list of (security) groups. Only instances with the provided security groups will be used in the cluster discovery. (NOTE: You could provide either group NAME or group ID.)

      • AVAILABILITY_ZONES_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> AVAILABILITY_ZONES_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.availability_zones: Either a comma separated list or array based list of availability zones. Only instances within the provided availability zones will be used in the cluster discovery.

      • NODE_CACHE_TIME_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<org.elasticsearch.common.unit.TimeValue> NODE_CACHE_TIME_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.node_cache_time: How long the list of hosts is cached to prevent further requests to the AWS API. Defaults to 10s.

      • TAG_SETTING

        static final org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Setting<org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Settings> TAG_SETTING
        discovery.ec2.tag.*: The ec2 discovery can filter machines to include in the cluster based on tags (and not just groups). The settings to use include the discovery.ec2.tag. prefix. For example, setting discovery.ec2.tag.stage to dev will only filter instances with a tag key set to stage, and a value of dev. Several tags set will require all of those tags to be set for the instance to be included.
